column5: Taking some younger nephews and nieces to our remote camp on Manitoulin Island next week, south west end. Normally don't bother with live bait there, but taking the young ones this time has me considering bringing some in. I doubt bringing them from home would work out to well with the ferry crossing/travel time involved. Anyone on the rock have any suggestions?  Thanks in advance.
email Luke from wasstours.com  I am sure he can help you out.
bring worms...the kids will have more fun catchin sunnys and gills all day than catching 22 inch walleye

You could always stop in Sudbury, lively or espanola on the way, unless you're taking the ferry...  Ramakkos in Sudbury, Moxies in Lively.  I don't have a name in espanola, but I'm sure you can find bait there.
Probably find bait in little current or maybe sheguinda as well.  Mindemoya or manitowning are also possibilities.
